page.title: 09THE FERRY AT HAMPTON LOADE 2
page.content: There is a main wire going from one side of the river to the other.Another wire goes from this via the pulley to the boat.A third wire goes from this wire to the front of the boat.There is a rudder that they steer the boat with by hand.It is the force of the river current against this rudder which enables the boat to float across. As you go across the river you can sometimes see lots of wildlife such as otters,kingfishers and ducks.Sometimes you can see the occasional mink.In the Summer time there are lots of weeds which slow the river down and the ferry sometimes gets stuck.Someone has to wade in and cut the weeds down.There are also different species of fish including barbel,trout,perch,carp,minnow and eel.
